result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean Douglas L Rogers was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sean Douglas L Rogers is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Sean Douglas L Rogers was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: to any other sentence currently serving

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
3:25 PM Case called - appearances stated. 

Defendant Sean Douglas L Rogers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Sean Douglas L Rogers.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson states def. will be pleading no contest to the Disorderly Conduct charge (Misd), state will dismiss bail jumping (FE), state will recommend 90 days jail consecutive to any other sentence

Court reviews plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 
Court asks defendant for plea. Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to Ct. 1- Disorderly Conduct .
 
Court reviews the constitutional and fundamental rights with Defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the elements of the charge with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Court reviews the minimum / maximum penalties with defendant. Defendant states understanding. 

Court accepts the defendants plea and finds that the defendant knowingly, intelligently and  voluntarily enters plea. Court finds the defendant GUILTY of Ct. 1
Ct. 2 is dismissed upon motion of the state

Atty Steiner is heard on sentence -recommends 90 days jail, consecutive to any sentence currently being served
3:33 PM -Victim addresses the court at this time

Atty. Erickson is heard on sentence - corrects defendant's record as stated by Atty. Steiner - 2011 was Forfeiture conviction, otherwise recitation was accurate. 3 days jail credit.  Requests Court consider probation or in the alternative - concurrent sentence

Defendant is heard - 

3:42 - Court puts findings on the record - Sentences defendant to 90 days jail, consecutive to any other sentence currently serving. court costs, bond to be applied. 60 DTP after release from custody
no jail credit -(credit was given on prior revocation)
for disorderly conduct

records.addlTxt:
2:32 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Sean Douglas L Rogers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Sean Douglas L Rogers.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard. Information has been filed and ready to proceed to arraignment. 

Atty Erickson is heard and defendant waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. Court has reviewed the substitution of Judge.  Court will approve.  Notice of another hearing date will be send when another Judge is assigned to the case.

9:30 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Sean Douglas L Rogers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Sean Douglas L Rogers.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

1W - Officer Casey Cox, sworn
Exam by Atty Steiner
Cross by Atty Erikson 

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. 
Atty Erickson objects to bind over.  Atty Erickson is heard. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 

Defendant is heard and requests his bond be revoked.  
Atty Steiner is heard and the State opposes the request.  
Atty Erickson is heard.
Arraignment scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Arraignment on June 1, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court screen shares criminal complaint with defendant. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  

Defendant is heard.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel - Atty Jeffrey Warren Erickson
Hearing on May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:41 PM Defendant Sean Douglas Lee Rogers not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Sean Douglas Lee Rogers.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

State is heard. Requests a warrant. 
Atty Erickson is heard. Def is in Dane Co Jail. 
Dane Co Jail contacted the JA.

Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on May 4, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Hearing on April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:16 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Sean Douglas Lee Rogers appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests $150.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. No abusive or violent contact with CCA. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders $150.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. No abusive or violent contact with CCA.

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
